txt: Friedrich von Esmarch, German surgeon and academic (b. 1823)

entities.title: Friedrich von Esmarch
entities.description: Johannes Friedrich August von Esmarch was a German surgeon. He developed the Esmarch bandage and founded the Deutscher Samariter-Verein, the predecessor of the Deutscher Samariter-Bund.

heading: Deaths
txt: Adolphus Frederick VI, Grand Duke of Mecklenburg-Strelitz (b. 1882)

entities.title: Adolphus Frederick VI, Grand Duke of Mecklenburg-Strelitz
entities.description: Adolphus Frederick VI was the last reigning grand duke of Mecklenburg-Strelitz.

heading: Deaths
txt: Horst Wessel, German SA officer (b. 1907)

entities.title: Horst Wessel
entities.description: Horst Ludwig Georg Erich Wessel, commonly known as Horst Wessel, was a Berlin Sturmführer of the Sturmabteilung (SA), the Nazi Party's stormtroopers. After his murder in 1930, he was made into a martyr for the Nazi cause by Joseph Goebbels.

entities.title: Sturmabteilung
entities.description: The Sturmabteilung, literally "Storm Detachment", was the Nazi Party's original paramilitary wing. It played a significant role in Adolf Hitler's rise to power in the 1920s and 1930s. Its primary purposes were providing protection for Nazi rallies and assemblies; disrupting the meetings of opposing parties; fighting against the paramilitary units of the opposing parties, especially the Roter Front

heading: Deaths
txt: Nellie Melba, Australian soprano and actress (b. 1861)

entities.title: Nellie Melba
entities.description: Dame Nellie Melba GBE was an Australian operatic soprano. She became one of the most famous singers of the late Victorian era and the early 20th century, and was the first Australian to achieve international recognition as a classical musician. She took the pseudonym "Melba" from Melbourne, her home town.

heading: Deaths
txt: Edward Elgar, English composer and academic (b. 1857)

entities.title: Edward Elgar
entities.description: Sir Edward William Elgar, 1st Baronet, was an English composer, many of whose works have entered the British and international classical concert repertoire. Among his best-known compositions are orchestral works including the Enigma Variations, the Pomp and Circumstance Marches, concertos for violin and cello, and two symphonies. He also composed choral works, including The Dream of Gerontius, cha

heading: Deaths
txt: Leo Baekeland, Belgian-American chemist and engineer (b. 1863)

entities.title: Leo Baekeland
entities.description:
Leo Hendrik Arthur Baekeland 
(November 14, 1863 – February 23, 1944) was a Belgian chemist. He is best known for the inventions of Velox photographic paper in 1893, and Bakelite in 1907. He has been called "The Father of the Plastics Industry" for his invention of Bakelite, an inexpensive, nonflammable and versatile plastic, which marked the beginning of the modern plastics industry.

heading: Deaths
txt: Tomoyuki Yamashita, Japanese general (b. 1885)

entities.title: Tomoyuki Yamashita
entities.description: Tomoyuki Yamashita  was a Japanese general of the Imperial Japanese Army during World War II. Yamashita led Japanese forces during the invasion of Malaya and Battle of Singapore, with his accomplishment of conquering Malaya and Singapore in 70 days earning him the sobriquet "The Tiger of Malaya" and led to the British Prime Minister Winston Churchill calling the ignominious fall of Singapore to Ja

heading: Deaths
txt: John Robert Gregg, Irish-American publisher and educator (b. 1866)

entities.title: John Robert Gregg
entities.description: John Robert Gregg was an Irish educator, publisher, humanitarian, and the inventor of the eponymous shorthand system Gregg Shorthand.

heading: Deaths
txt: Paul Claudel, French poet and playwright (b. 1868)

entities.title: Paul Claudel
entities.description: Paul Claudel was a French poet, dramatist and diplomat, and the younger brother of the sculptor Camille Claudel. He was most famous for his verse dramas, which often convey his devout Catholicism. Claudel was nominated for the Nobel Prize in Literature in six different years.

heading: Deaths
txt: Stan Laurel, English actor and comedian (b. 1890)

entities.title: Stan Laurel
entities.description: Stan Laurel was an English comic actor, writer, and film director who was part of the comedy duo Laurel and Hardy. He appeared with his comedy partner Oliver Hardy in 107 short films, feature films, and cameo roles.

heading: Deaths
txt: Madhubala, Indian actress and producer (b. 1933)

entities.title: Madhubala
entities.description: Madhubala was an Indian actress and producer who worked in Hindi films. One of the most popular and the highest-paid actress during the 1950s and early 1960s, she appeared in 73 Bollywood films in a career spanning over two decades. In the media, she is referred to as one of the most beautiful, greatest and influential personalities of Indian cinema.

heading: Deaths
txt: Saud bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, 2nd King of Saudi Arabia (b. 1902)

entities.title: King of Saudi Arabia
entities.description: The king of Saudi Arabia is the monarchial head of state and head of government of Saudi Arabia who holds absolute power. He is the head of the Saudi Arabian royal family, the House of Saud. The king is called the "Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques", a title that signifies Saudi Arabia's jurisdiction over the mosques of Masjid al Haram in Mecca and Al-Masjid an-Nabawi in Medina, the title has been

heading: Deaths
txt: Dickinson W. Richards, American physician and physiologist, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1895)

entities.title: Dickinson W. Richards
entities.description:
Dickinson Woodruff Richards, Jr. was an American physician and physiologist. He was a co-recipient of the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1956 with André Cournand and Werner Forssmann for the development of cardiac catheterization and the characterisation 
of a number of cardiac diseases.

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine is awarded yearly by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institutet for outstanding discoveries in physiology or medicine.

heading: Deaths
txt: Harry Ruby, American composer and screenwriter (b. 1895)

entities.title: Harry Ruby
entities.description: Harry Rubenstein, known professionally as Harry Ruby, was an American composer and screenwriter, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970. He was married to silent film actress Eileen Percy.

heading: Deaths
txt: L. S. Lowry, English painter (b. 1887)

entities.title: L. S. Lowry
entities.description: Laurence Stephen Lowry was an English artist. His drawings and paintings depict Pendlebury, Lancashire, where he lived and worked for more than 40 years, Salford and its vicinity.

heading: Deaths
txt: W. A. C. Bennett, Canadian businessman and politician, 25th Premier of British Columbia (b. 1900)

entities.title: W. A. C. Bennett
entities.description: William Andrew Cecil Bennett was a Canadian politician. He was the 25th Premier of British Columbia. With just over 20 years in office, Bennett was and remains the longest-serving premier in British Columbia history. He was usually referred to as W. A. C. Bennett, although some referred to him either affectionately or mockingly as "Wacky" Bennett. To his close friends, he was known as "Cece".

entities.title: Premier of British Columbia
entities.description: The premier of British Columbia is the first minister, head of government, and de facto chief executive for the Canadian province of British Columbia. Until the early 1970s, the title prime minister of British Columbia was often used. The word premier is derived from the French word of the same spelling, meaning "first"; and ultimately from the Latin word primarius, meaning "primary".

heading: Deaths
txt: Herbert Howells, English organist and composer (b. 1892)

entities.title: Herbert Howells
entities.description: Herbert Norman Howells was an English composer, organist, and teacher, most famous for his large output of Anglican church music.

heading: Deaths
txt: José Napoleón Duarte, Salvadoran engineer and politician, President of El Salvador (b. 1925)

entities.title: José Napoleón Duarte
entities.description: José Napoleón Duarte Fuentes was a Salvadoran politician who served as President of El Salvador from June 1, 1984 to June 1, 1989. He was mayor of San Salvador before running for president in 1972. He lost, but the election is widely viewed as fraudulent. Following a counter-coup in 1979, Duarte led the subsequent civil-military Junta from 1980 to 1982. He was then elected president in 1984, defea

entities.title: President of El Salvador
entities.description: The president of El Salvador, officially known as the president of the Republic of El Salvador, is the head of state and head of government of El Salvador. He is also, by Constitutional Law, the commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of El Salvador. The office was created in the Constitution of 1841. From 1821 until 1841, the head of state of El Salvador was styled simply as Head of State.

heading: Deaths
txt: James Herriot, English veterinarian and author (b. 1916)

entities.title: James Herriot
entities.description: James Alfred Wight, better known by his pen name James Herriot, was a British veterinary surgeon and author.

heading: Deaths
txt: Tony Williams, American drummer, composer, and producer (b. 1945)

entities.title: Tony Williams (drummer)
entities.description: Anthony Tillmon Williams was an American jazz drummer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Philip Abbott, American actor and director (b. 1924)

entities.title: Philip Abbott
entities.description: Philip Abbott was an American character actor. He appeared in several films and numerous television series, including a lead role as Arthur Ward in the crime series The F.B.I. Abbott was also the founder of Theatre West in Los Angeles.

heading: Deaths
txt: The Renegade, American wrestler (b. 1965)

entities.title: The Renegade (wrestler)
entities.description: Richard Wilson was an American professional wrestler. He was best known for his tenure in World Championship Wrestling (WCW) under the ring name The Renegade, where he was a one-time WCW World Television Champion.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ofra Haza, Israeli singer-songwriter and actress (b. 1957)

entities.title: Ofra Haza
entities.description: Bat-Sheva Ofra Haza-Ashkenazi, known professionally as Ofra Haza, was an Israeli singer, actress and Grammy Award-nominee recording artist, commonly known in the Western world as "The Israeli Madonna", or "Madonna of the East". Her voice has been described as a "tender" mezzo-soprano.

heading: Deaths
txt: Stanley Matthews, English footballer and manager (b. 1915)

heading: Deaths
txt: Howie Epstein, American bass player, songwriter, and producer (b. 1955)

entities.title: Howie Epstein
entities.description: Howard Norman Epstein was an American musician best known as a bassist with Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers.

heading: Deaths
txt: Robert K. Merton, American sociologist and academic (b. 1910)

heading: Deaths
txt: Vijay Anand, Indian director, producer, screenwriter, and actor (b. 1934)

entities.title: Vijay Anand (Hindi film maker)
entities.description: Vijay Anand, also known as Goldie Anand, was an Indian filmmaker, producer, screenwriter, editor and actor, who is known for acclaimed films such as Guide (1965), Teesri Manzil (1966), Jewel Thief (1967) and Johny Mera Naam (1970). He made most of his films for the in-house banner Navketan Films and was part of the Anand family.

heading: Deaths
txt: Sikander Bakht, Indian politician, Indian Minister of External Affairs (b. 1918)

entities.title: Minister of External Affairs (India)
entities.description: The Minister of External Affairs is the head of the Ministry of External Affairs of the Government of India. One of the senior-most offices in the Union Cabinet, the chief responsibility of the Foreign Minister is to represent India and its government in the international community. The Foreign Minister also plays an important role in determining Indian foreign policy. Occasionally, the Foreign Mi

heading: Deaths
txt: Telmo Zarra, Spanish footballer (b. 1921)

entities.title: Telmo Zarra
entities.description: Pedro Telmo Zarraonandía Montoya, known as Telmo Zarra or simply Zarra, was a Spanish football forward. He spent the majority of his career at Athletic Bilbao, from 1940 to 1955, for whom he remains the top scorer in competitive matches with 335 goals.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Ritchie, English footballer (b. 1941)

entities.title: John Ritchie (footballer, born 1941)
entities.description: John Henry Ritchie was an English footballer. He is Stoke City's all-time record goalscorer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Janez Drnovšek, Slovenian economist and politician, 2nd President of Slovenia (b. 1950)

entities.title: Janez Drnovšek
entities.description: Janez Drnovšek was a Slovenian liberal politician, President of the Presidency of Yugoslavia (1989–1990), Prime Minister of Slovenia and President of Slovenia (2002–2007).

entities.title: President of Slovenia
entities.description: The office of President of Slovenia, officially President of the Republic of Slovenia, was established on 23 December 1991 when the National Assembly passed a new Constitution as a result of independence from the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.

heading: Deaths
txt: Paul Frère, Belgian race car driver and journalist (b. 1917)

heading: Deaths
txt: Orlando Zapata, Cuban plumber and activist (b. 1967)

entities.title: Orlando Zapata
entities.description: Orlando Zapata Tamayo was a Cuban political activist and a political prisoner who died after hunger striking for more than 80 days. His death received international attention, and was viewed as a significant setback in Cuba's relationship with the U.S. the EU and the rest of the world.

heading: Deaths
txt: Nirmala Srivastava, Indian religious leader, founded Sahaja Yoga (b. 1923)

entities.title: Nirmala Srivastava
entities.description: Nirmala Srivastava, also known as Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi, was the founder of Sahaja Yoga, a new religious movement sometimes classified as a cult. She said "You cannot know the meaning of your life until you're connected to the power that created you". She claimed to have been born fully realised and spent her life working for peace by developing and promoting a simple technique through which pe

entities.title: Sahaja Yoga
entities.description: Sahaja Yoga was founded in 1970 by Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi. Shri Nirmala Srivastava is more widely known as Her Holiness Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi or as "Mother" by her followers, who are called Sahaja yogis.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Raggio, American lawyer and politician (b. 1926)

entities.title: William Raggio
entities.description: William Raggio was an American politician and a former Republican member of the Nevada Senate. He represented Washoe County's 3rd district from 1972 until his retirement in 2011. He is the longest-serving member in the history of the State Senate.

heading: Deaths
txt: David Sayre, American physicist and mathematician (b. 1924)

heading: Deaths
txt: Kazimierz Żygulski, Polish sociologist and activist (b. 1919)

heading: Deaths
txt: Eugene Bookhammer, American soldier and politician, 18th Lieutenant Governor of Delaware (b. 1918)

entities.title: Eugene Bookhammer
entities.description: Eugene Bookhammer was an American politician who served as the 18th lieutenant governor of Delaware, as a Republican, from 1969 to 1977. He served under Governors Russell W. Peterson and Sherman W. Tribbitt. Bookhammer served in the U. S. Army during World War II. He was in the lumber mill business. Bookhammer also served in the Delaware State Senate. With author Richard Carter, in 2009 he wrote a

entities.title: Lieutenant Governor of Delaware
entities.description: The Lieutenant Governor of Delaware is the second ranking executive officer of the U.S. state of Delaware. Lieutenant governors are elected for a term of four years in the same general election as the U.S. President and take office the following January.

heading: Deaths
txt: Joseph Friedenson, Holocaust survivor, Holocaust historian, Yiddish writer, lecturer and editor (b. 1922)

heading: Deaths
txt: Julien Ries, Belgian cardinal (b. 1920)

heading: Deaths
txt: Lotika Sarkar, Indian lawyer and academic (b. 1945)

heading: Deaths
txt: Alice Herz-Sommer, Czech-English Holocaust survivor, pianist and educator (b. 1903)

entities.title: Alice Herz-Sommer
entities.description: Alice Herz-Sommer, also known as Alice Herz, was a Prague-born Jewish classical pianist, music teacher, and supercentenarian who survived Theresienstadt concentration camp. She lived for 40 years in Israel, before migrating to London in 1986, where she resided until her death, and at the age of 110 was the world's oldest known Holocaust survivor until Yisrael Kristal was recognized as such.

entities.title: Holocaust survivor
entities.description: Holocaust survivors are people who survived the Holocaust, defined as the persecution and attempted annihilation of the Jews by Nazi Germany and its allies before and during World War II in Europe and North Africa. There is no universally accepted definition of the term, and it has been applied variously to Jews who survived the war in German-occupied Europe or other Axis territories, as well as t

heading: Deaths
txt: Roger Hilsman, American soldier, academic, and politician (b. 1919)

heading: Deaths
txt: James Aldridge, Australian-English journalist and author (b. 1918)

entities.title: James Aldridge
entities.description: Harold Edward James Aldridge was an Australian-British writer and journalist. His World War II despatches were published worldwide and he was the author of over 30 books, both fiction and non-fiction works, including war and adventure novels and books for children.

heading: Deaths
txt: Rana Bhagwandas, Pakistani lawyer and judge, Chief Justice of Pakistan (b. 1942)

entities.title: Chief Justice of Pakistan
entities.description: The chief justice of Pakistan is the head of the court system of Pakistan and the chief judge of the Supreme Court of Pakistan. The officeholder is the senior most of 17 senior justices of the Supreme Court of Pakistan.

heading: Deaths
txt: W. E. "Bill" Dykes, American soldier and politician (b. 1925)

heading: Deaths
txt: Peter Lustig, German television host and author (b. 1937)

entities.title: Peter Lustig
entities.description: Peter Fritz Willi Lustig was a German television presenter, voice actor and author of children's books who has become especially well known as leading actor in the weekly children's television show Löwenzahn, which he hosted from 1979 up until 2006. During its first year the show was called Pusteblume. He also hosted the show Mittendrin (1987–95), narrated the film Gordos Reise ans Ende der Welt (

heading: Deaths
txt: Jacqueline Mattson, American baseball player (b. 1928)

heading: Deaths
txt: Katherine Helmond, American actress (b. 1929)

entities.title: Katherine Helmond
entities.description: Katherine Marie Helmond was an American actress. Over her five decades of television acting, she was known for her starring role as ditzy matriarch Jessica Tate on the sitcom Soap (1977–1981) and her co-starring role as feisty mother Mona Robinson on Who's the Boss? (1984–1992). Helmond also appeared in a 1993 episode of The Upper Hand, the British version of Who's the Boss?. She also played Doris

heading: Deaths
txt: Ahmed Zaki Yamani, Saudi Arabian politician (b. 1930)

entities.title: Ahmed Zaki Yamani
entities.description: Ahmed Zaki Yamani was a Saudi Arabian politician who served as Minister of Petroleum and Mineral Resources from 1962 to 1986, and a minister in the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) for 25 years. With degrees from institutions including New York University School of Law, Harvard Law School, and a doctorate from the University of Exeter, Yamani became a close adviser to the S
